name: Industrial Microbes
headline: We design and build microbes to make chemicals greener at lower cost.
description: At iMicrobes, we believe there are opportunities for biology to solve our biggest problems.  Our mission is to work with the world’s largest companies to use new raw materials and recycle waste for chemical production, polymers, agriculture, and space exploration.

![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/9e035180-bc80-41d1-b846-76654e408b50/element.png)
# We make biobased materials using renewable, low-carbon feedstocks.
Our programmable microbes turn ethanol and greenhouse gases into net-zero materials.
#  Industrial Microbes raises seed round. Read our blog post to learn more. 
#  Industrial Microbes raises seed round. Read our blog post to learn more. [ ](http://imicrobes.com/</blog>) Industrial Microbes raises seed round. Read our blog post to learn more. 
[ Partner with us ](http://imicrobes.com/</contact>)
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/2b365762-077f-4ca6-8e25-ddebbbe970a7/bg_2.jpg)
![Image of babies](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/3e18d6b3-a40a-490a-b552-0f2783003ac3/baby.jpg)
# It's time to change how we make things.
Consumers have spoken: They want sustainable bioproducts with reduced environmental impact across their lifecycle, and at an affordable cost.
The good news? Alternatives to petrochemicals in industrial manufacturing are becoming available and scaling quickly..
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/b479150d-3369-4e4c-8f22-8efb68da361f/ABPDU.jpg)
_The Industrial Microbes and ABPDU teams collaborating on a recent scale-up project._
# Scaling up biobased solutions
iMicrobes has engineered programmable microbes that turn renewable feedstocks like ethanol and methane, into drop-in chemicals and materials. 
We have successfully scaled our processes to produce low-carbon footprint acrylic acid precursors working closely with a wide range of partners.
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/51888f38-ea8b-467e-bad9-c2ed3eee6b2e/brewing+%282%29.jpg)
# Like brewing whiskey
**Fermentation, heating, and distillation.** The high-tech version of whiskey brewing, powered by an advanced engineered microbe.
# We shrink costs & emissions
By preventing biomethane from directly entering the atmosphere and using it as a feedstock, we can achieve 30% to 45% cost reduction and net zero emission.
[ Read the data ](http://imicrobes.com/</resources>)
![image of the eBook ROI of Waste](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/97e08901-80f4-4609-a50f-dbef3fe11714/whitepaper.jpg)
# High performance materials
Using synthetic biology, we program our microorganisms to use a wide range of renewable feedstocks instead of petroleum.
The outcome is an identical molecule that can be used today with net-zero or negative emissions.
## ACRYLIC
![acrylic paint brush](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/61bcbf76-42ee-4430-bab4-f67e6a10b841/acrylic.jpg)
## CARBON FIBER
![carbon fiber bike from net zero materials](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/ad4726d8-1157-4076-bfe8-034c0ec1bb5b/carbon.jpg)
## BIOPOLYMERS
![methacrylic panels from net-zero materials](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/c81e0507-56ae-4624-ab17-4c500adf3a88/methacrylic.jpg)
# 9

![image 1 of partners and funding members](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/11b354aa-48f4-4ec7-82d6-b542dba5ddb7/funding_01.png)
![image 2 of partners and funding members](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/79ad44e3-ecf6-4184-8358-3a0b935774a1/funding_02.png)
![image 3 of partners and funding members](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/3c0e4f92-1581-4c59-ad5a-aa93e2b3bedf/funding_03.png)
![image 4 of partners and funding members](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/f5385f34-36d2-49cb-a52f-d430b3aaba07/funding_04.png)
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/a660ef65-ee3b-4585-8ab0-4a50414bca7b/science.jpg)
# How can we work together?
iMicrobes provides the strain, bioprocess, samples and intellectual property.
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/904b86d4-ca04-4b71-8e30-edc84574b4ec/1.png)
We co-develop the biomanufacturing process.
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/5cc8b405-312e-4236-b82f-7c51484ec000/2.png)
You take the materials to market.
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1e426a68df2a40e2e0ef49/e63d395c-2355-4d21-ab52-231ad12675bc/3.png)

generated_description:
**Industrial Microbes: Crafting a Greener Future with Biology**

Founded in 2014 and part of Y Combinator’s W15 batch, Industrial Microbes is driven by a clear mission: developing engineered microbes to create greener chemicals at a lower cost. Nestled in Alameda, California, this ambitious team of twelve is on a mission to revolutionize how we produce essential materials.

Their focus is twofold. First, they aim to collaborate with global enterprises to transform waste into viable resources for producing chemicals, polymers, and even solutions for space exploration. Think of it as a biologically-inspired approach to sustainability, where the materials we need come from renewable sources instead of fossil fuels.

At the heart of their technology are programmable microbes that utilize low-carbon feedstocks like ethanol and methane. Through a process reminiscent of brewing whiskey—fermentation, heating, and distillation—they create net-zero materials that can seamlessly replace traditional petrochemical products. Their innovations are not just theoretical; they’ve successfully scaled their processes to produce low-carbon acrylic acid precursors, having already partnered with notable commercial allies.

What’s impressive is their commitment to not just innovation but also impact. By using biomethane in their processes, they’ve achieved cost reductions of 30% to 45%, while striving for net-zero emissions—a powerful double win in the climate fight.

With 9 years of development under their belt, 22 patents, and $10 million in funding, Industrial Microbes stands ready to make significant contributions to the fields of climate change mitigation and sustainable materials. Their work is marked by a belief that biology can solve some of our most pressing challenges, and they invite collaboration to expand the reach of their biomanufacturing capabilities.

To learn more, you can visit their website [here](http://imicrobes.com). In a world increasingly aware of its environmental footprint, Industrial Microbes exemplifies how innovative thinking can lead to practical solutions, paving the way for a sustainable future.
